utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are helping Monica learn how to roller skate by rolling her between themselves.]

utterances.transcript: So who's idea was it to put everybody in the diner on skates?
Oh, some idiot customer put a suggestion in the suggestion box.
Oh my God, they took my idea!
That was you?!
Yeah! Okay, here you go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah! Okay, here you go. (rolls her back to Rachel)

utterances.transcript: Rachel, I made you a cocoa.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (bringing Rachel a mug) Rachel, I made you a cocoa.
[He distracts her from catching Monica and Monica slams into her, knocking her down. Monica then falls on top of her.]

utterances.transcript: Oh my God, are you guys okay?
Are you all right?
Oh my.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (leaving Central Perk and seeing Monica laying on top of Rachel who is moaning in pain.) Oh my.
(They both turn and give him a dirty look.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching Quincy M.E. as Chandler is walking into the living room from his bedroom.]

utterances.transcript: Hey.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sporting a goatee) Hey.

utterances.transcript: Hey. Y'know with that goatee you kinda look like Satan.

Oh, so that's why the priest threw holy water on me. Okay, listen, you have to cheer up! Okay? You should come out with Ross and me, I mean anything is better than sitting around here crying all day about Kate.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, so that's why the priest threw holy water on me. (there's no reaction from Joey) Okay, listen, you have to cheer up! Okay? You should come out with Ross and me, I mean anything is better than sitting around here crying all day about Kate.

utterances.transcript: Hey I was crying because, because nobody believed Quincy's theory. Okay?
Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey.
I'm gonna be on TV!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (triumphantly) I'm gonna be on TV!!

utterances.transcript: No way!
Yeah! They're putting together this panel to talk about these fossils they just found in Peru and The Discovery Channel's gonna film it!
Oh my God! Who's gonna watch that?!
Thanks. You ready to go?
Yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. (they start to leave)

utterances.transcript: Saw a girl with that vest.
Thanks.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thanks. (He takes off the vest and throws it on the floor.)

utterances.transcript: While most of us think of chocolate bunnies and baskets as traditional Easter gifts. Some people insist on giving live chicks as presents. Unfortunately, the sad fact remains that most of these little guys won't live to see the fourth of July. Because of as a result of improper care, they will be dead.

(Joey is intrigued by the idea) Unfortunately, the sad fact remains that most of these little guys won't live to see the fourth of July. (Joey starts to call a place to buy a little baby chick) Because of as a result of improper care, they will be dead.

utterances.transcript: Yeah, hi. You guys got any of those baby chicks? 'Cause I was watching this ah, commercial on TV and man, those guys are cute!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on phone) Yeah, hi. You guys got any of those baby chicks? 'Cause I was watching this ah, commercial on TV and man, those guys are cute!

Okay.

utterances.transcript: Can you believe he just offered me a restaurant?
What a jerk! You want me to kick his ass?

I mean this has been like my dream since I got my first Easy Bake Oven and opened Easy Monica's Bakery. I mean I would kill for this job. I mean I can totally do this job, and God knows I paid my dues. But Pete's just doing this because he has a crush on me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I mean this has been like my dream since I got my first Easy Bake Oven and opened Easy Monica's Bakery. I mean I would kill for this job. I mean I can totally do this job, and God knows I paid my dues. (She removes her fake breasts) But Pete's just doing this because he has a crush on me.

utterances.transcript: And you're still not attracted to him at all?
Hmm, no. I mean how can I accept a restaurant from him? I-I-I-I can't. I couldn't even accept a necklace from Stu Vincent in the seventh grade.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Moondance Diner, Pete is talking to Monica about the restaurant.]

utterances.transcript: So? I mean have you thought about it?
Okay. Here's the thing.
Oh no, not the thing. I hate the thing. What's the thing?
I can't do it. I'm sorry, I wish I could, but umm, see you have these feelings for me....
Wait, wait, wait, wait, that's-that's what you're worried about? If that's the problem, we've got no problem.
Huh?
No! Look, I was gonna tell you this over dinner, but I met somebody else. On my trip.
Oh?

Her name's Ann, she's a journalist. Ahh, we met on the plane. She asked me if she could finish off my peanuts, I thought she said something else, we had a big laugh. Yeah, I just, I mean I got, I got tired of waiting.
Oh, that's great! I mean I'm-I'm sorry, but I'm so happy for you. And now I can work for you!
I guess you can.
Oh my God! Oh, this is incredible! Ohh! All right, y'know what? I'm just gonna roll right into that office and-and quit!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh my God! Oh, this is incredible! Ohh! (she rolls over and kisses him on the cheek) All right, y'know what? I'm just gonna roll right into that office and-and quit!

utterances.transcript: All right.
Okay. Can you give me a little push?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay. (she gets ready to go) Can you give me a little push?

utterances.transcript: Yeah, sure. Good luck!
I'm quitting!! Woo-hoo! I'm okay!! I'm all right!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (rolling towards the office) I'm quitting!! Woo-hoo! (She rolls through a doorway and out of sight. We then hear a big crash, and see Monica roll past the door the other way.) I'm okay!! I'm all right!!

utterances.transcript: Wow! That's exciting, you went to Japan, made up a woman.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Pete) Wow! That's exciting, you went to Japan, made up a woman.

utterances.transcript: What?
I'm just saying, this woman, I mean she's fictitious. No?
Why would you say that?

'Cause you're still into Monica. So you told her there was somebody else so she would agree to work with you, so 'cause you figure oh if you spent a lot of time together, maybe something might happen, and...
You're good. You're good!
Yeah, no, I'm fairly intuitive and psychic. It's a substantial gift.
Listen, can you promise me that you won't tell her though?
Absolutely, oh I promise. Tell her what?
Thanks a lot.
No I'm serious. I mean I'm intuitive, but my memory sucks.

utterances.transcript: Hey.
Hey.
How's she doing?
She?

I don't know. I can't tell, what ever it was went back in too quickly.

utterances.transcript: Well, anyway, I got to go change, I'm ah, meeting some of the cast for drinks.
Excuse me?

I stayed home from work today while you were at rehearsal so somebody could be here with our chick!

You don't think I get up when you get up?
Ohhh, here it comes.
Yes, here it comes! I'm stuck here all day, and then you come in and spend two seconds with us and then expect to go off gallivanting with your friends? Well I don't think so mister!
Hey!! I need to relax! Okay? I was working all day!

That's not what I said. Okay, I just meant...
I know what you meant!! You notice that ever since we got this chick, we've been fighting a lot more than we used too?

utterances.transcript: I don't know, maybe we weren't ready to have a chick.
I'll take her back tomorrow.
Do you think we'll get our three bucks back?

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Ohhh, hey! All right, listen, I-I have that TV thing in like two hours, and I need your help, okay? What do you think? This blue suit, or this brown one?

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Rachel's Bedroom, Ross is finishing up her make-up.]

utterances.transcript: There you go! Good enough for your party, huh?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (She turns and looks in the mirror, and it's way, way over done. She looks like she has two black eyes.)

utterances.transcript: Sure.
Yep?
Sure, I'll just sit next to the trans-sexual from purchasing.
Okay, come on! All right, I gotta go! So good luck at the party. Okay?
Oh wait, Ross, would you just stay and help me get dressed?
Sure, okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (checks his watch) Sure, okay.

utterances.transcript: Okay. Okay, great! Umm, okay, just turn around.
What?
I don't want you to see me naked!
Rachel, I've seen you naked a million times. I ate hot fudge off you naked. Remember, I-I sucked that mini-marshmallow out of your belly button?
Yeah, but that was different. Y'know? I mean, we were, we were going out then, now I think it's weird.
Rach, y'know I can see you naked any time I want.
What?
All I have to do is close my eyes. See? Woo-hoo!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: All I have to do is close my eyes. See? (closes his eyes) Woo-hoo!!

utterances.transcript: Ross! Stop that!
Ah, I'm sorry.
Come on! I don't want you thinking of me like that any more!
Ahh, sorry, nothing you can do about it. It's one of my ah, rights as the ex-boyfriend. Oop, oh yeah!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ahh, sorry, nothing you can do about it. It's one of my ah, rights as the ex-boyfriend. (closes his eyes again) Oop, oh yeah!

utterances.transcript: Stop it! Cut it out! Cut it out!
Okay, okay, I'm sorry, it will never happen... Uh-oh! Wait a minute! Wait-wait, now there are a hundred of you and I'm the king.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, okay, I'm sorry, it will never happen... (closes eyes) Uh-oh! Wait a minute! Wait-wait, now there are a hundred of you and I'm the king.

utterances.transcript: Rosss...
Come on, would you grow up? It's no big deal.
All right. Fine.
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right. (She starts to take off her robe) Fine.

utterances.transcript: Yowzah!!!
O-kay!! See what you did, I'm gonna be doing it by myself now. Okay?
Aww, come on.
That's it. Ow!!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: That's it. (She crawls onto the bed) Ow!!!

utterances.transcript: Oh my God!
Oh-ow!
All right.
Ow!
Look...
Ow!
Okay.
Ow!
Rach?
Ow! Ow!
Easy. Easy. You have to go to the hospital. Okay?
Okay, I do.
Okay.
I really do.
Okay, I'm gonna get your coat and then I'll-I'll put you in a cab.
Okay. Oh wait, wait-wait, you're not gonna come with me?
Of course I am. I just have to make a call.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (He thinks about it) Of course I am. I just have to make a call.

utterances.transcript: Okay.
Okay?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay? (goes into the living room)

utterances.transcript: Thank you. Oww!!!! God!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thank you. (She goes to take off her make-up and screams in pain) Oww!!!! God!

utterances.transcript: What?! I wh-, what's wrong?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (rushing back in) What?! I wh-, what's wrong?

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry, I just can't go to the hospital lookin' like this.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Monica is trying to find out what Phoebe won't tell her.]

utterances.transcript: Does it involve travel?
Noo!
Does it involve clogs?
Oh, wait, wait. Clogs, or claws?
Clogs.
No.
Claws?!
No.
Okay, so it doesn't involve Ross or Rachel or Chandler or Joey. But, what about Pete?
No!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Shaking her head yes) No!

utterances.transcript: What is it?! What about Pete?
I don't know!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I don't know! (frantically points at Monica)

utterances.transcript: Okay, I feel like I'm talking to Lassie. All right, Phoebe would you just tell me!
I can't!!
Okay, I gotta go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, I gotta go. (gets up)

utterances.transcript: I, but you're so close! No!
Okay, does it involve something to do with Pete's computer company?
Oh, just go. You're never gonna get it!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching Baywatch with the baby chick. He's on one leather chair, the chick is on the other. It's watching Yasmine Bleeth run and is chirping.]

utterances.transcript: I know. See, yes. That's Yasmine Bleeth, she's a completely different kind of chick. I love you both. But in very different ways.
Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Ohhh. Ahh! What are you doing?! I thought you were gonna take her back to the store today.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sees he's watching Baywatch) Ohhh. (sees he still has the chick) Ahh! What are you doing?! I thought you were gonna take her back to the store today.

utterances.transcript: I did! But the store wouldn't take her back! So then I took her to the shelter, and you know what I found out?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Joey wants to know, but Chandler doesn't want to discuss it by the chick, so he and Joey move over to the windows and away from the chick.)

utterances.transcript: If they can't find a home for her, they kill her! And I'm not gonna let that happen to little Yasmine!
Okay, good, good, good, 'cause, good, 'cause I was kinda having second thoughts too.
Okay. And it's not just chicks y'know? It's all kinds of other animals!
That's horrible! Well, you did the right thing man.
Thanks, I'm glad you see it that way.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (He hear a duck start quacking, and see it waddle into the living room from the bathroom. Joey wants to know what's with the duck.)

utterances.transcript: Ohhh-hoo, funny story!

plots: Joey does the right thing by returning a chick to a shelter for it to be taken care of , but he also finds a way to keep a duck within his household .
Joey has a pet chick named Yasmine whom Joey was planning to return , but was gladly able to keep

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Pete's Restaurant's Kitchen, Pete is showing Monica around the kitchen.]

utterances.transcript: I don't believe this! Wow, look at this refrigerator! It's gigantic! I mean I could live in this thing! I'd be cold, but I'm always cold. Oh my God, look at these spider burners! I love spider burners.
So you like it?
Oh, it is sooo perfect. Thank you so much.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, it is sooo perfect. Thank you so much. (runs over and hugs him)

utterances.transcript: Oh, you're welcome.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, you're welcome. (He takes a deep breath)

utterances.transcript: Did you just smell my hair?
Nooo. Uh-huh, no way. What? No.
Oh God.
What?
You still have feelings for me don't you?
Now, nooo! I'm just excited about the restaurant, that's all.
Pete.
Okay, I love you. Is that so bad?
No, it's not bad. It's not bad at all. It's-it's really nice.
Look, the only who stands to get hurt is me. And I'm okay with that.
You may be okay about getting hurt, but I am not okay with being the one who hurts you. That's why I can't take this job.
What?
And well, we probably shouldn't see each other anymore. I'm sorry.
Okay, yeah. I mean... If that's, if that's really what you want, okay.
Okay, bye.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (She kisses him on the cheek, and he kisses her back on the mouth.)

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry things didn't work out...
All right shut up for a second and let me just see something. Oh, wow!
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right shut up for a second and let me just see something. (She kisses him back on the lips) Oh, wow! (They then hug and kiss, very passionately.)

plots: Monica and Pete are about to stop seeing each other , but then Monica and Pet kiss ... and Monica finally feels it .
When Pete smells Monica 's hair and admits he still loves her , they end up kissing passionately .
Pete and Monica debate whether or not they still love each other .
After inspecting the kitchens , Monica accepts the job but as Monica hugs Pete , Pete tries to catch the scent of Monica 's hair .
Monica and Pete share a passionate kiss , beginning their relationship .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Hallway Between The Apartments, Ross and Rachel are coming back from the hospital. Ross is helping her up the stairs.]

utterances.transcript: Okay, you'd tell me the truth. Right?
Rach, you can't look fat in an x-ray.
Okay.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (As they approach the door, Chandler comes out carrying his duck.)

utterances.transcript: Okay! Now you stay out here, and you think about what you did!!
That's a duck.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Chandler) That's a duck.

utterances.transcript: That's a bad duck!!! How'd the thing go tonight, Ross?
utterances.transcript_with_note: That's a bad duck!!! (to Ross) How'd the thing go tonight, Ross?

utterances.transcript: Oh, it was, nah, well....
What thing? What thing?
Nothing, ah there was this thing at the museum. Come on. Easy.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Nothing, ah there was this thing at the museum. Come on. (they go into her apartment) Easy.

utterances.transcript: Okay, now when you come back I hope you remember that, that chick is not a toy!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to the duck) Okay, now when you come back I hope you remember that, that chick is not a toy! (He goes back into the apartment)
[cut to inside Monica and Rachel's]

utterances.transcript: What thing? What is this thing?
I was kinda, supposed to be on TV tonight for The Discovery Channel.
Oh my God!
Yeah.
Ross, why didn't you tell me that?
Eh, 'cause I knew that if I told you, you'd make me go, and I knew you needed someone to be with you tonight. Come on. Come on.
I cannot believe you.
What?
That is the sweetest thing, I just....

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They both look at each other for a while)

utterances.transcript: You should get some sleep.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (breaking the silence) You should get some sleep.

utterances.transcript: Okay.
So, I'll umm...
Oh, I'm sorry I spoiled you're evening.
No, that's, no, as long as you're okay. So I'll ah, I'll see you tomorrow.
Um-hmm, yeah.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (He leaves)

utterances.transcript: See ya.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (After he closes the door) See ya.
(In the hallway, Ross all dejected, sits down on the step.)

utterances.transcript: What did you do?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (coming out of his apartment and seeing Ross) What did you do?
